page.title: 07The Bridge Inn, Bridgerule
page.content:
The Bridge Inn was built in 1660. It was built specifically as an Inn and had its own brewery across the cowyard. The brewery was later converted into a skittle alley and remained in this capacity until recently when local people converted a room in the Inn into a bar and skittle alley. The original alley is now used as a games room.
The Inn has had many owners and after the second world war it was taken over by Whitbread Breweries who owned it until 1970 when it went into private ownership. It is now a free house and has not only a good local trade but serves bar meals and attracts good, widespread custom and tourist trade.
